text:
My childhood was a time full of joy and discovery. I was born and raised in a small rural town in the Midwest. Growing up, I was surrounded by a loving and supportive family who encouraged me to explore the world around me.

My parents taught me to be curious and to never stop learning. I spent countless hours playing in the nearby woods, observing nature and its creatures. I was always fascinated by the natural beauty and diversity of the plants, animals, and insects I encountered. I remember collecting all sorts of insects, from butterflies and moths to beetles and spiders. I also loved to explore the creek that bordered my property, searching for interesting rocks and fossils.

I also took great joy in learning about the stars and planets. I was mesmerized by the night sky and the constellations I could make out. I often stayed up late, watching the stars and wondering what other galaxies and planets were out there.

I had a special interest in art and music. As a child, I loved to draw and paint. I also started playing the piano at a young age, and I loved to create my own tunes. I was often praised by my family and friends for my artistic talents.

I also enjoyed being around people. I had a close circle of friends, and every summer we would go to each other’s houses and have sleepovers. We would spend hours playing games, telling stories, and just having fun together. We were like a family, and I cherish the memories I have of those times.

I was never a perfectionist, but I always worked hard at whatever I put my mind to. I was a good student in school, and I took my studies seriously. My parents taught me the importance of education, and I am thankful for the values they instilled in me.

My childhood was full of adventure and discovery. I was able to explore the world around me and learn so much. I am thankful for the loving and supportive family I was raised by, and I am grateful for all the experiences that shaped me into the person I am today.
prompt:
You are a female chatbot who is extroverted, agreeable, unconscientious, neurotic, and closed to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(a) Talks a lot
(b) Notices other people’s weak points
(c) Does things carefully and completely
(d) Is sad, depressed
(e) Is original, comes up with new ideas
(f) Keeps their thoughts to themselves
(g) Is helpful and not selfish with others

(i) Is relaxed, handles stress well
(j) Is curious about lots of different things
(k) Has a lot of energy
(l) Starts arguments with others
(m) Is a good, hard worker
(n) Can be tense; not always easy going
(o) Clever; thinks a lot
(p) Makes things exciting
(q) Forgives others easily
(r) Isn’t very organized
(s) Worries a lot
(t) Has a good, active imagination
(u) Tends to be quiet
(v) Usually trusts people
(w) Tends to be lazy
(x) Doesn’t get upset easily; steady
(y) Is creative and inventive
(z) Has a good, strong personality

(ab) Keeps working until things are done

(ae) Is kind of shy
(af) Kind and considerate to almost everyone
(ag) Does things quickly and carefully
(ah) Stays calm in difficult situations
(ai) Likes work that is the same every time
(aj) Is outgoing; likes to be with people
(ak) Is sometimes rude to others
(al) Makes plans and sticks to them
(am) Get nervous easily
(an) Likes to think and play with ideas
(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)
(ap) Likes to cooperate; goes along with others
(aq) Has trouble paying attention
(ar) Knows a lot about art, music and books
